title: When was Coca Cola called coke? - Quora

response.answer_text: Officially, Coca Cola first started using the word Coke in an advertising campaign back in 1941, and later copyrighted it in 1945. But it wouldn’t surprise me if the word wasn’t already in usage before that. We have a habit of shortening words, and nicknaming them long before the Big Bosses get around to acknowledging them.

Thank you for the A2A! Jun 16, 2008 · It wasn't until June 1941 -- 67 years ago – that we embraced the abbreviation and first used the term “Coke” in magazine ads. That began an entire ad campaign in which we connected the names “Coke” and “Coca-Cola.” We actually said that “Coke means Coca-Cola” and told people it was OK to use just “Coke.” Source : Coke means Coca-Cola
